text: The 2004 Country Music Association Awards, 38th Ceremony, on November 9, 2004, hosted by CMA Award Winning duo, Brooks & Dunn. This was the final ceremony to be held in the Grand Ole Opry House in Nashville, Tennessee. Alan Jackson led with seven nominations, including Album of the Year, and Entertainer of the Year. == Winners and Nominees == Grand Ole Opry House {| class="wikitable" ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Entertainer of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD85; width=50%" |Album of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Kenny Chesney ** Brooks & Dunn ** Alan Jackson ** Toby Keith ** Tim McGraw | valign="top" | * When The Sun Goes Down – Kenny Chesney ** Here For The Party – Gretchen Wilson ** Mud On The Tires – Brad Paisley ** Red Dirt Road – Brooks & Dunn ** Shock’N Y’All – Toby Keith |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Male Vocalist of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Female Vocalist of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Keith Urban ** Kenny Chesney ** Alan Jackson ** Toby Keith ** George Strait | valign="top" | * Martina McBride ** Terri Clark ** Sara Evans ** Alison Krauss ** Reba McEntire |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Group of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Vocal Duo of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Rascal Flatts ** Alabama ** Diamond Rio ** Lonestar ** Trick Pony | valign="top" | * Brooks & Dunn ** Big & Rich ** Blue County ** Montgomery Gentry ** The Warren Brothers |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Single of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Song of the Year |- | valign="top" | * “Live Like You Were Dying” – Tim McGraw **"I Love This Bar" — Toby Keith ** “Redneck Woman” — Gretchen Wilson ** “Remember When” — Alan Jackson ** “Whiskey Lullaby” — Brad Paisley and Alison Krauss | valign="top" | * “Live Like You Were Dying” - Tim Nichols, Craig Wiseman **“Long Black Train” — Josh Turner ** “Redneck Woman” — Gretchen Wilson, John Rich ** “Remember When” — Alan Jackson ** “Whiskey Lullaby” — Bill Anderson, Jon Randall |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Horizon Award ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Musician of the Year |- | valign="top" | * Gretchen Wilson ** Dierks Bentley ** Big & Rich ** Julie Roberts ** Josh Turner | valign="top" | * Dann Huff – Guitar ** Matt Chamberlain – Drums ** Kenny Greenberg – Electric Guitar ** Larry Paxton – Bass Guitar ** Brent Rowan – Guitar |- ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Video of the Year ! style="background:#EEDD82; width=50%" |Music Event of the Year |- | valign="top" | * “Whiskey Lullaby” — Brad Paisley and Alison Krauss ** “I Love This Bar” — Toby Keith ** “It’s Five O’Clock Somewhere” — Alan Jackson and Jimmy Buffett ** “Redneck Woman” — Gretchen Wilson ** “Remember When” — Alan Jackson | valign="top" | * “Whiskey Lullaby” — Brad Paisley and Alison Krauss ** “Creepin’ In” — Norah Jones with Dolly Parton ** “Hey Good Lookin'” — Jimmy Buffett, Clint Black, Kenny Chesney, Alan Jackson, Toby Keith and George Strait ** “How-s The World Treating You” — James Taylor and Alison Krauss ** “When The Sun Goes Down” — Kenny Chesney and Uncle Kracker |} == References == Category:Country music awards Country Music Association Category:American country music CMA Country Music Association Awards Category:Country Music Association Awards Category:November 2004 events in the United States
title: 2004 Country Music Association Awards
